title: Indian team in US for fresh talks on trade deal
content: Indian officials are in the US, led by chief negotiator Rajesh Agarwal, for trade deal talks aimed at bridging differences. Agriculture is a key sticking point, with India hesitant to lower tariffs on sensitive items like maize and soybean due to the prevalence of genetically modified crops in the US.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Paaji, Paaji!' and the hunt for a Birmingham bounceback
content: In Birmingham, the Indian cricket team seeks comfort amidst a series loss, finding familiarity in the city's "desi" atmosphere. Despite a strong performance in the first Test, India faces pressure to regroup, with young players needing to step up. The team emphasises camaraderie and a positive dressing room environment to fuel their performance in the upcoming Birmingham Test.

title: ‘One particular country objected’: MEA on why Rajnath refused to sign SCO statement
content: India declined to endorse the joint statement at the SCO Defence Ministers' meeting in Qingdao due to the omission of its terrorism concerns. Defence Minister Rajnath Singh insisted on acknowledging the Pahalgam attack, attributed to Lashkar-e-Taiba, while the statement referenced activities in Balochistan. Consensus eluded the member states, leading to the abandonment of the joint statement.

title: America’s China threat: Huawei’s new laptop fuels debate on US sanctions
content: Huawei's new MateBook Fold uses a SMIC-made 7nm chip, showcasing China's tech self-reliance amid U.S. sanctions. Despite this, China lags behind TSMC's advanced chip technology. U.S. restrictions hinder China's access to cutting-edge chipmaking tools and AI chips, intensifying competition in the tech sector. China is pinning its hopes on Huawei and SMIC for advanced chipmaking.

title: Rs 1 'Pulse' candy: How DS Group aims to make it a Rs 1,000 cr brand
content: Homegrown FMCG firm Dharampal Satyapal Group's Pulse candy is poised to become a Rs 1,000-crore brand within two years, projecting its current sales. Having already crossed Rs 750 crore in FY25, the company plans strategic expansion into adjacent product categories and innovative formats.

title: IND vs ENG: England handed massive boost; 150+ kmph pacer joins squad
content: A 30-year-old pacer is all set to make a sensational return to England's Test squad after more than four years, boosting their pace attack for the second Test against India. His inclusion aims to strengthen England's lead in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy series, following their impressive win in the first Test at Headingley.

title: Operation Bihali: 1 Jaish terrorist killed in J&K's Udhampur, 3 others trapped
content: In a joint operation in Basantgarh, the Indian army and Jammu and Kashmir police neutralized a terrorist. Operation Bihali was launched based on intelligence inputs, leading to the encirclement of four Jaish-e-Mohammad militants who were under surveillance for a year. Despite challenging weather conditions, security forces continue search operations to neutralize the remaining terrorists.

title: US Embassy warns: Missing info on visa form can get you rejected; Applicants must list all…
content: The US Embassy in India has cautioned visa seekers to accurately disclose their social media presence. Failing to list all usernames and handles used across various platforms in the last five years on the DS-160 form could result in visa denial and future ineligibility.

title: India vs England Tests: Will he, won't he? The Jasprit Bumrah dilemma!
content: The Indian cricket team faces a crucial decision regarding Jasprit Bumrah's participation in the upcoming Test matches against England. Bumrah is slated to play only three Tests. Team management must decide whether he will play in Birmingham or Lord's. A decision to rest Bumrah will necessitate a replacement. Arshdeep Singh and Kuldeep Yadav are potential candidates.

title: Nvidia’s next target: CEO Jensen Huang eyes this tech sector after AI; ‘We’re working towards…’
content: Nvidia is focusing on robotics after artificial intelligence. CEO Jensen Huang believes robotics, especially self-driving cars, present a huge market. Nvidia's Drive platform is already used by Mercedes-Benz. The company envisions billions of robots powered by Nvidia tech. Nvidia sees itself as an AI infrastructure provider, not just a chip company. The company's stock recently hit a record high.

title: Donald Trump’s tariff wars deal a blow! US economy shrinks 0.5%; worse than estimates
content: The US economy contracted by 0.5% in the first quarter of 2025, primarily due to a surge in imports spurred by President Trump's trade war. This import surge, up 37.9%, significantly dragged down GDP, marking the first quarterly decline in three years. Despite the downturn, economists anticipate a rebound in the second quarter, projecting a 3% growth.

title: 'Life very alluring': Why SC rejected doctors’ plea against transfer from Bengaluru
content: The Supreme Court refused to entertain a plea by government doctors challenging their transfer orders from Bengaluru, stating the city's allure isn't grounds to resist relocation. Justices noted no prejudice was caused by the transfers. The doctors contested the Karnataka State Civil Services rules governing medical personnel transfers, arguing inadequate time was given to object to the draft rules.

title: How Shubhanshu Shukla scripted history and made India proud
content: The Dragon capsule 'Grace,' carrying the Axiom-4 crew, successfully docked with the International Space Station, marking a historic moment as Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla became the first Indian to enter the orbiting lab. Launched from Kennedy Space Center, the mission signifies a maturing space ecosystem with private firms shaping access to low-Earth orbit.

title: 'Treat on merit’: MEA flags concerns over new social media rules for US visa
content: The Ministry of External Affairs says the US should assess Indian visa applications fairly. This follows the US embassy's new guidelines. Applicants must now share social media details. Omitting information may lead to visa denial. The US embassy in India also asks student visa applicants to make social media accounts public.

title: India tour of England diaries: KL Rahul travels with his mattress; coaches' evening stroll
content: The Indian cricket team travelled to Birmingham from Leeds on June 25 for their next Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy match. KL Rahul's personal mattress highlighted players' preference for comfortable sleep. Head coach Gautam Gambhir and batting coach Sitanshu Kotak were seen exploring the city. Coffee runs and senior players mentoring youngsters marked their downtime, with training possibly resuming on Friday.

title: 'I can’t afford to pay': Dwyane Wade’s wife Gabrielle Union on financial strain
content: Gabrielle Union, wife of Dwyane Wade, discussed her financial strategies at a recent event. She highlighted the need for multiple income streams. Union emphasized managing expenses, including supporting her extended family. She also mentioned dividing expenses with her husband, Dwyane Wade. The couple recently navigated Wade's health challenges. They continue to share updates about their lives with their fans.

title: Dylan Harper drafted by Spurs: NBA champ Ron Harper is his dad; meet mom Maria Harper
content: Dylan Harper, son of Rutgers star Maria Harper and NBA legend Ron Harper, was recently drafted by the San Antonio Spurs. Growing up in a basketball-oriented family, both parents played a crucial role in shaping his career. His mother coached him from elementary school, while his father, a former Chicago Bulls and Lakers player, provided inspiration.

title: Exclusive| 'Country over my child': KL Rahul's first words before England Tests
content: KL Rahul prioritised national duty, choosing to prepare for the England Test series soon after becoming a father. He aimed to lead the team in the absence of senior players. Rahul's commitment was evident as he played an unofficial Test, scoring a century. He opened alongside Yashasvi Jaiswal and scored another century in the first Test.

title: NFL vs. NBA player salaries: Who earns more?
content: In American sports, NBA players earn significantly more than NFL players. The average NBA salary is about $11.91 million, much higher than the NFL's $2.8 to $3.2 million. Smaller NBA rosters and revenue distribution favor basketball. NBA stars like Stephen Curry earn huge amounts. The NFL's larger teams and shorter careers contribute to lower pay. The NBA's global appeal boosts player earnings.

title: Exclusive: No Magnus Carlsen in India! Freestyle Chess event called off over lack of sponsors
content: The Indian leg of the Freestyle Chess Grand Slam, scheduled for September in New Delhi, has been cancelled due to a lack of sponsors. This is a disappointment for fans hoping to see Magnus Carlsen compete in India. CEO Jan Henric Buettner confirmed the move and will step down in July. The next event is in Las Vegas this July.

title: Mahindra to launch brand new EV, SUVs, teases new platform: Debut date, details
content: Mahindra & Mahindra will introduce a new vehicle platform. It is likely to be called 'Nu'. The unveiling is scheduled for August 15, 2025. This platform will support petrol, diesel, hybrid, and electric vehicles. It will underpin future Mahindra SUVs. Production will take place at the Chakan facility. Mahindra has a tradition of August 15 announcements.

title: Navy staffer arrested: Vishal leaked defence info to Pak during Op Sindoor; wanted to repay debts
content: Vishal Yadav, a clerk at the Naval office in New Delhi, has been arrested for allegedly leaking classified defence information to a Pakistani handler. He shared sensitive details, including those related to Op Sindoor, in exchange for money to fund his online gaming addiction. Yadav was apprehended in Jaipur under the Official Secrets Act.

title: 'Hey daddy': Nato chief’s nickname for Trump sticks; White House shares video
content: Following a NATO summit where he was jokingly called "Daddy" by Secretary Rutte, the White House shared a video of Donald Trump set to the song "Hey Daddy." This occurred after Trump likened the Iran-Israel conflict to a schoolyard fight, prompting Rutte's jest about needing strong language.

title: 'I would love to avenge the loss': Jake Paul eyes revenge as Tommy Fury hints at rematch
content: Tommy Fury has ignited rematch talks with Jake Paul, suggesting a fight is likely within the next year. Fury, who handed Paul his first loss, claims he wasn't at his best during their initial encounter and is confident of a repeat victory. Paul, while open to avenging his defeat, also eyes a world championship.

title: Space: Nasa’s curiosity rover captures rare Martian ‘spiderwebs’
content: NASA's Curiosity rover finds strange rock formations on Mars. These look like spiderwebs. The rover spots these on Mount Sharp. Scientists think these formations formed from old groundwater. The mineral-rich ridges may hold clues about Mars' past. The discovery could help understand if Mars once supported microbial life. Curiosity will study the formations further.

title: 'Birds of prey': Cong reacts to Tharoor’s cryptic post, says 'even a free bird must watch'
content: Following Shashi Tharoor's cryptic social media post, the Congress party has intensified its criticism of the Thiruvananthapuram MP. Manickam Tagore cautioned Tharoor to be wary of 'hawks' and 'vultures,' while Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge indirectly criticized Tharoor for allegedly prioritizing Modi over the nation.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 ends above 25,500; BSE Sensex up 1,000 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, rallied strongly in trade on Thursday. While Nifty50 went above 25,550, BSE Sensex surged over 1,000 points intraday.

title: Taking tough stand: India refuses to sign SCO joint statement as Pak, China go soft on terror
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh took a firm stand at the SCO meeting in China. He refused to sign a joint statement due to disagreements on terrorism. Singh condemned the use of terrorism as a state policy, targeting Pakistan. He highlighted the Pahalgam attack and called for collective action against terrorism.

title: Not just iPhones: Android makers boost India-to-US exports amid tariff push
content: Driven by tariffs and government incentives, smartphone exports from India to the US are surging. Motorola, leveraging Indian manufacturing, significantly increased Android phone shipments to the US, capitalizing on tariff advantages over China. Samsung also boosted exports, while Apple remains the largest exporter overall.

title: Sonam & Ishwarya: Two states, two murders, one sinister blueprint
content: In chilling echoes of betrayal, two honeymoon murders have rocked India. In Telangana, a land surveyor was allegedly killed at his wife's lover's behest after she shared his location. Similarly, in Meghalaya, a newlywed was murdered on his honeymoon, with his wife accused of paying her lover to orchestrate the killing.

title: 'I’m broke?' Antonio Brown claps back at bankruptcy reports with $24 mn screenshot
content: Former NFL star Antonio Brown is making headlines again, this time for filing Chapter 11 bankruptcy despite earning over $100 million during his career. Reports claim Brown has less than $50,000 in assets and owes nearly $3 million. In response, Brown posted a screenshot of a $24 million account, seemingly disputing the claims.

title: IND vs ENG: Stuart Broad blames India's team selection; urges 2 changes
content: Stuart Broad analyzed India's recent Test defeat. He thinks India's team selection was wrong. Broad suggested Kuldeep Yadav should have played. He also mentioned Arshdeep Singh could offer a different angle. Broad advised against panicking after one loss. India needs minor adjustments, not major changes. The second Test is scheduled for July 2 at Edgbaston.

title: Controversial post: FIR filed against K'taka BJP for comparing Indira Gandhi to Hitler; Cong protests
content: Karnataka BJP faces legal trouble after an FIR was filed over a contentious social media post. The post allegedly likened Indira Gandhi to Adolf Hitler, sparking outrage and a police investigation. The complaint, lodged by a KPCC general secretary, accuses the BJP of defamation and inciting social unrest through the now-deleted content.

title: Israel-Palestine: Aussie cricketer Khawaja boycotts media outlet - here's why
content: Usman Khawaja declined a post-game interview with SEN after their controversial dismissal of journalist Peter Lalor for social media posts about Gaza. Khawaja, a vocal advocate for human rights, previously faced restrictions for displaying supportive messages on his shoes. Lalor expressed his gratitude for Khawaja's unwavering support, highlighting the cricketer's principled stance.

title: AI 171 crash: 'Data from front black box downloaded, being analysed,' says govt; probe on
content: The black box data from the Air India Dreamliner crash in Ahmedabad on June 12 is currently being analyzed to determine the cause of the accident. The investigation team, including members from the NTSB, began data extraction on June 24.

title: Hyderabad techie takes car onto railway tracks; trains services halted on route
content: A distressed woman drove her car onto railway tracks near Shankarpally, Telangana, disrupting train services for half an hour. Railway staff apprehended her after she hurled stones with an iron rod. The woman, an IT employee from Lucknow who recently lost her job, was handed over to the police and taken for a medical checkup.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Continues to raise the bar' LSG's Goenka goes all praise for Pant
content: Rishabh Pant has achieved a career-best seventh position in the ICC Test rankings after his remarkable centuries in the first Test against England. He equalled Andy Flower's record as the only wicketkeepers to score two centuries in a single Test. Pant's success is inspiring, especially after his near-fatal car accident in 2022.

title: 'Water won't go anywhere': Union minister Patil reiterates Centre's stand on IWT suspension
content: Union Jal Shakti Minister CR Patil has firmly stated that India's decision to suspend the Indus Waters Treaty (IWT) is in the nation's best interest, dismissing warnings from Pakistan. Patil emphasised that any decision regarding the treaty will prioritize India's benefit, brushing aside remarks made by former Pakistani foreign minister Bilawal Bhutto Zardari as empty threats.

title: UPSC CISF AC (Exe) LDCE 2025 result: Written exam merit list released; download link active
content: The Union Public Service Commission (UPSC) has released the written exam results for the CISF AC (Exe) LDCE 2025, held on April 27. Shortlisted candidates will proceed to the PST, PET, and MST stages. CISF will notify candidates about the next phase. Results can be downloaded from the UPSC website. Final marks will be published after interviews.

title: Honeymoon murder: Pistol, ammo found in Indore nullah; backup plan to kill Raja
content: Shillong police recovered a country-made pistol, magazines, and ammunition purchased by Raj, intended for Raja Raghuvanshi's murder if the initial attempt failed. Acting on a lead, authorities found the weapon in a stream and recovered ₹50,000 from Shilom James' car. The accused, including Shilom James, Lokendra Tomar, and Balvinder Ahirwar, were flown to Shillong for further investigation and court appearance.

title: Round 2 mock: What we're hearing before the second night of the NBA draft
content: Who are the best players still on the board -- and where could they go? We project the draft's next 29 picks.

title: Bucs ink Bowles, GM Licht to multiyear extensions
content: Coach Todd Bowles, who has guided the Bucs to three of their four straight NFC South titles, and GM Jason Licht have signed multiyear extensions with Tampa Bay.

title: NHL, NHLPA launch World Cup 2028 host process
content: The NHL and NHLPA have launched their host city selection process for World Cup of Hockey 2028, officially marking the return of the international best-on-best tournament.

title: Ronaldo signs new deal to extend Al Nassr stay
content: Cristiano Ronaldo has signed a new contract with Al Nassr to extend his stay in the Saudi Pro League.

title: 'Once in a lifetime': Mavs take Flagg at No. 1
content: The Mavericks selected Duke forward Cooper Flagg with the first pick of the 2025 NBA draft Wednesday night.

title: Nets use 4 of historic 5 1st-round picks on guards
content: The Nets became the first team in league history to make five selections in the opening round, opting for four guards, including three point guards.

title: Suns acquire Hornets' Williams, draft Maluach
content: The Suns acquired Hornets center Mark Williams for the No. 29 pick and a 2029 first-round pick, and then selected center Khaman Maluach with the No. 10 pick.

title: Bailey surprised by Jazz: 'No idea' they'd pick me
content: Rutgers forward Ace Bailey said he had "no idea" the Jazz had interest in taking him with the No. 5 pick, and a source told ESPN that Utah was not among his preferred destinations.

title: Sources: 84-game NHL season part of CBA talks
content: An increase over the NHL's current 82-game schedule has been discussed internally by the league, and the topic is part of negotiations with the players' union for the new CBA, sources told ESPN.

title: One last offseason move for all 32 teams: Signings, extensions and trades that make sense
content: Which signings, trades and extensions should still happen this offseason? We suggested one final move for every NFL team as we near training camp.

title: Hey, kids, want to hit .350 in the majors? Jacob Wilson says start playing Fortnite
content: The A's star is a former first-round pick and the son of a major leaguer, but the secret to his success starts with a video game controller.

title: Dirk, Dallas pro teams react to Mavs drafting Flagg at No. 1
content: Congratulations poured in after the Dallas Mavericks made Cooper Flagg the top pick of the 2025 NBA draft.

title: Chavez? Tyson? Canelo? Inside the process to pick a Jake Paul opponent
content: Andreas Hale talks to Jake Paul, his team and other matchmakers to explain the challenges of finding the right matchup.

title: NHL draft buzz: Sharks not set at No. 2?
content: The first round is Friday. Our reporters pass along the latest intel they're hearing from around the league.

title: Four big questions: Will there finally be a repeat champ? What’s at stake for the QBs?
content: History would indicate the Eagles won't repeat, so who else in the NFC East stands a chance to win the division?

title: Taylor Swift joins Kane Brown in surprise performance at Tight End University
content: Taylor Swift performs "Shake It Off" and walks the red carpet with Travis Kelce at Tight End University.

title: How Elite 11 changed the ESPN 300 QB rankings
content: Following the summer camp circuit, the newest rankings have some big changes for the class's signal-callers.

title: 5 questions the USMNT must answer in Gold Cup knockouts (and before 2026 World Cup)
content: The USMNT finished the Gold Cup group stage without a loss, and yet no one seems particularly comforted by that. These five questions need answers ASAP.

title: Wrexham to open Ch'ship season at Southampton
content: Wrexham will begin their first Championship campaign in over 40 years away at former Premier League side Southampton, before a tough run in their first five.

title: Liverpool sign Kerkez, spending nears $197M
content: Liverpool have completed the signing of Bournemouth left-back Milos Kerkez, the Premier League champions have announced.

title: Arsenal starlet Lewis-Skelly signs long-term deal
content: Myles Lewis-Skelly has signed a new long-term contract at Arsenal, the Premier League club confirmed on Thursday.

title: Barça chief Laporta: Madrid have model of 'power'
content: Barcelona president Joan Laporta has said Clásico rivals Real Madrid have a model of "power" and "signing players" that contrasts with how the Catalan club is run.

title: Éderson shuts down exit talk; to remain at Man City
content: Éderson has committed his future to Manchester City and insists he intends to stay at the Etihad Stadium next season.

title: Otamendi: 'I don't see Messi missing World Cup'
content: Benfica defender Nicolás Otamendi has said he doesn't expect Argentina teammate Lionel Messi to miss the 2026 World Cup.

title: Xabi calls on Vini, Mbappé to 'improve' off the ball
content: Xabi Alonso called on Real Madrid stars like Vinícius Júnior and Kylian Mbappé to "improve" their off-the-ball work-rate ahead of the team's final Club World Cup group game with Salzburg.

title: Argentina 2nd tier player, 18, dies during surgery
content: Camilo Nuin, an 18-year-old player for Argentina second division team San Telmo, died on Wednesday during knee surgery.

title: Meet the favorites, sleepers and spoilers of NASCAR's first in-season tournament
content: Whether you're a weekly watcher or a casual Cup fan, this guide will get you up to speed on the drivers in the bracket.

title: 'Championships, fan experience, community': After 20 years as Vikings owners, Wilfs have one last goal
content: The Wilf family built a revered stadium and gets rave reviews from players, but the Vikings have yet to win a Super Bowl.

title: 'Everything's on the table' for Connor McDavid's NHL future
content: The NHL's best player has one year left on his contract. Will he re-sign, or will he test free agency in 2026?

title: Who makes the Hall of Fame in 2026? Ranking the top candidates
content: Does Patrice Bergeron make it in his first year eligible? What about Keith Tkachuk? Predicting the next class.

title: What impact will Cooper Flagg have as a rookie?
content: Andre Snellings looks at what fantasy managers can expect from Cooper Flagg as a rookie this season, and where he should be drafted in leagues.

title: 10 undervalued pass-catchers with intriguing upside or safer floors
content: Matt Bowen lists his favorites with week-winning potential and others who are dependable, despite lower ADPs.

title: PLL Power Rankings ahead of Week 5: Cannons the new No. 1
content: Margins are tight this season, but one club has risen to the top. Where do the rest land in the rankings?

title: Five underappreciated starting pitchers you need to grab now
content: Tristan H. Cockcroft looks at the surprising lack of love for some of the starting pitchers with very strong underlying metrics.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United explore Zaïre-Emery move
content: Manchester United are looking to make an ambitious move for PSG midfielder Warren Zaïre-Emery. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Feeling Lightheaded, Excited About Next 14 Days: Shubhanshu Shukla From ISS
content: Indian Air Force (IAF) Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla said he is excited about the scientific tasks that he and the crew will perform for the next 14 days in the International Space Station (ISS).

title: Axiom-4 Docking LIVE: Shubhanshu Shukla Becomes 1st Indian Astronaut On ISS
content: Shubhanshu Shukla Axiom-4 Mission Docking LIVE Updates: Shubhanshu Shukla has become India's first astronaut on the International Space Station, as the SpaceX's Axiom-4 mission docked on to the orbital lab.

title: Zohran Mamdani's Journey From A "B-List" Rapper To NYC Mayoral Candidate
content: Mamdani has humourously labelled himself as a "B-list rapper" and on his X account, which he used as a rapper, he promoted "Nani", a tribute to his grandmother, that debuted in April 2019.

title: Jagan Reddy Goes To Court, Wants Name Removed From Runover Case
content: Former Chief minister of Andhra Pradesh, YS Jaganmohan Reddy, has filed an appeal in the High Court alleging that his name has deliberately been added as accused in the case involving the man run over by a car earlier this moth.

title: Video: Drunk Man Climbs Tree To Pluck Jackfruit In Bengaluru, Falls 50 Feet
content: An area near the police commissioner's office in Bengaluru witnessed unusual and frightening scenes on Thursday afternoon after a drunk man climbed a tall tree to pluck jackfruit. Videos showed him dangling from a branch, hanging on for dear life.

title: Video: Hugs And Welcome Drink As ISS Welcomes Shubhanshu Shukla And Team
content: Indian Air Force (IAF) Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla and three other astronauts successfully docked their Dragon spacecraft with the International Space Station (ISS) this evening.

title: After Maha Kumbh Mela, Adani Group To Offer Seva At Puri Rath Yatra
content: Following its extensive, mostly volunteer-driven initiative to feed the masses during the Maha Kumbh Mela in Prayagraj earlier this year, the Adani Group has now shifted its focus to another of India's most revered religious festivals - the Rath Yatr

title: Russia To Train 600 Chinese Soldiers To Counter US, NATO Weapons: Report
content: Russia is planning to train at least 600 Chinese soldiers this year to counter the US and NATO weapons, according to a new report in the Ukrainian media.

title: No Elections Contested Since 2019: Poll Body To Delist 345 Political Parties
content: The Election Commission on Thursday said it has started proceedings for the delisting of 345 registered unrecognized political parties (RUPPs) which have failed to fulfil the essential condition of contesting even a single election for the last six y

title: Terrorist Killed In Joint Operation By Army, Police In J&K's Udhampur
content: The Indian Army and the Jammu and Kashmir Police, in a joint operation, killed a terrorist in an encounter in Basantgarh in the Udhampur district of the Union Territory.

title: After Iran Leak, White House Tightens Intel Access, Drops Tulsi Gabbard
content: Director of National Intelligence Tulsi Gabbard earlier testified that Iran was not actively pursuing a nuclear weapon

title: Death Count Rises To 4, 7 Still Missing In Himachal Flash Floods
content: With the recovery of two more bodies from a hydro project site in Himachal Pradesh's Kangra district that was hit by floods on Wednesday, the death toll has risen to four, officials said on Thursday.

title: Burqa On Statue Of Liberty? How MAGA Is Fuming Over Zohran Mamdani's Win
content: The post shows a digitally altered picture of the Statue of Liberty covered in a black burqa. Another MAGA supporter, Don Keith shared the picture with the caption, "Congratulations New York".

title: Did Dutch Queen Maxima Mock Trump? Viral Video Sparks Debate
content: Did Queen Maxima of the Netherlands mock US President Donald Trump while posing for a candid photograph? A video that suggests so has gone viral on social media.

title: India Says Evacuated 3,426 Indian From Iran, 818 From Israel In Op Sindhu
content: The Ministry of External Affairs spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal said that India, so far have evacuated 3,426 Indian nationals from Iran and 818 Indian nationals from Israel in Operation Sindhu.

title: Video: Driver Runs Tractor Over 2 Men During Fight In Karnataka, They Survive
content: An argument between a tractor driver and a goods vehicle over a minor collision escalated into a confrontation, and the tractor driver ran over two men. But they miraculously survived.

title: Khamenei Says US "Gained Nothing" From Attacks On Iran
content: Iran will never surrender to the US and any future aggression would come at a great cost, its supreme leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, said today in his first remarks after the ceasefire between Iran and Israel

title: Can't Ignore Hindi, But Don't Make It Compulsory From Class 1: Sharad Pawar
content: NCP (SP) chief Sharad Pawar on Thursday said that Hindi should not be made mandatory from Class 1 in Maharashtra, underscoring that if a new language is to be introduced, it should be done only after Class 5.

title: No Consensus On Terror At SCO: Ministry On Why India Did Not Sign Statement
content: India refused to sign the joint statement at the SCO meet chaired by China since a consensus could not be reached on terrorism.

title: Actor Krishna Arrested In Cocaine Case, Days After Srikanth
content: In a big step in the investigation into Chennai's high-profile cocaine case, the city police arrested actor Krishna on Thursday, a day after he was detained for interrogation.

title: On cue from Trump, MAGA unloads on 'communist lunatic' Zohran Mamdani

title: Cheers, tears and Tiranga pride: Family of Shubhanshu Shukla get emotional - watch
content: The TOI Science Desk stands as an inquisitive team of journalists, ceaselessly delving into the realms of discovery to curate a captivating collection of news, features, and articles from the vast and ever-evolving world of science for the readers of The Times of India. title: Núñez, Grealish, Sancho: Soccer's toughest summer transfers
content: the summer transfer window has been open for business since June 16 . some leading players risk becoming high-profile "untransferables" in the weeks ahead . the problem has become particular to premier league players because only a select group of clubs from outside football can afford to sign them or pay them .

title: Bueckers, then who? Ranking the 8 best rookies in the WNBA this season
content: a handful of young players in this electric rookie class are having unexpected breakouts . this group includes recent college graduates and players signed from overseas . a general manager told ESPN that Bueckers could "impact the league immediately" and "be dangerous right away"

title: Trade grades: Mammoth get an A+ for Peterka addition
content: if the Utah Mammoth could add at least one top-six forward to their roster, a move would be a big deal . a new move for GM bill Armstrong would be the latest in a long-term deal for a GM . the new move is the latest significant move for the GM's new contract .

title: Experts' picks, best bets: Who should bettors back at UFC 317?
content: the main event will feature former featherweight champion Ilia Topuria taking on former lightweight titleholder Charles Oliveira . the 155-pound belt recently vacated by Islam Makhachev has not lost since July 2020 . Alexandre Pantoja returns to the Octagon seeking his fourth consecutive men's flyweight title defense against Kai Kara-France .

title: Experts cite overuse in spate of Achilles injuries in NBA
content: Tyrese Haliburton's Achilles tendon injury has become all-too-familiar headlines in professional sports . this NBA season saw more than its usual share in the playoffs alone . two other high-profile athletes tore their Achilles earlier in the season . he has ruled out for the remainder of thursday .

title: A'ja Wilson, Josh Allen among 2025 ESPYS candidates; vote now
content: the 2025 ESPYS presented by Capital One are July 16 . the Oklahoma City Thunder guard is nominated in two categories: Best Athlete - Men's Sports, and Best NBA Player . Simone Biles and Sydney McLaughlin-Levrone are up for best . Ilona Maher and Ezra Frech represent in both categories .

title: 2026 recruiting class rankings: Florida schools make big moves
content: two new teams within the top 10 . Texas A&M, Georgia, Texas, Miami and Florida State are all big movers . the noles have double-digit commitments including several ESPN 300 prospects . it's a major shift in the class rankings .

title: Bradley's take: Will Paul's hook land better than Julio César Chávez Jr.'s?
content: a 10-round cruiserweight bout against former middleweight champion Julio Cesar Chavez Jr. will be his 13th pro fight of 2025 . this will be Paul's first pro fight against a former boxing champ other than last November's fight against the then 58-year-old Mike Tyson . Chavez has fought only once since 2021 .

title: Final draft rankings: Schaefer, Misa, Hagens, then ...?
content: the top 64 are ranked here, along with details of their game, areas for development, perception among NHL scouts and an NHL projection . some players grade at higher or lower value than in previous rankings, but their position considers how likely they are to become NHL players based on their developmental needs and perception .

title: Best picks, surprising moves and top trades from the NBA draft: Making sense of Round 1
content: a round 1 of the 2025 draft on Wednesday began with Cooper Flagg . the first of three Duke players selected was drafted by the Dallas Mavericks with the no. 1 pick . there were winners and surprises, such as the Utah Jazz .

title: ⚾ MLB Power Rankings: New No. 1, top-5 debut
content: the Dodgers fall from third to no. 7 after dropping 10** of their past 12 games . the Astros crack the top five for the first time this season . our expert panel has ranked every team based on what we've seen so far .

title: Cheating and forgery case: Kerala HC grants anticipatory bail to actor and producer of Manjummel Boys
content: Bail granted on the condition that they should be present for questioning before the Maradu police on July 7

title: Minor girl kidnapped, sexually abused by youth in Krishna district
content: The accused from Anantapur allegedly trapped the girl studying in a government school and took her to various places and raped her, says CWC Member Chandragiri Radha Kumari

title: Appoint junior resident doctors at Kozhikode MCH, demands medical PG association
content: The sudden exit of nearly 250 doctors has left a major gap in the system as the next batch was yet to complete their exams

title: ‘Not tenable’: ECI sources on Congress seeking digital copy of Maharashtra voters’ list
content: The ECI sources said while Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has been demanding for machine-readable, digital copy of the electoral roll for the last seven months, such demand by the Congress is “not new”

title: Andhra Pradesh’s space policy aims at attracting ₹25,000 crore investment, generating 35,000 jobs
content: Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu gives the green signal for development of two Space Cities at Lepakshi and Tirupati; Andhra Pradesh’s timely policy intervention will give it a competitive edge in the expanding space economy, says Honorary Adviser and former ISRO Chairman Somanath

title: Heavy rain: updated list of residents in landslide-prone areas in Kozhikode sought
content: The DDMA has drawn up a plan to identify a feasible solution for the speedy relocation of families living in vulnerable areas

title: Burgled by waves
content: The residents of Chellanam, a coastal panchayat in Ernakulam district, are once again bearing the brunt of sea erosion this monsoon season. M.P. Praveen meets the hapless residents of the village at their homes, which have been ravaged by the intruding waves

title: Not paid for 4-5 months, garbage collectors in Bengaluru struggle to make ends meet
content: The civic body officials say Solid Waste Management has only been removed from BBMP and shifted to Bengaluru Solid Waste Management Ltd, but contractors are insisting that they be paid from BBMP, leading to an impasse which has been resolved this week

title: Nara Lokesh to inaugurate V.R.C. High School in Nellore on July 6
content: Of the 5,000 admission applications, 1,050 poor students have received the opportunity to study, says MA&UD Minister

title: Infrastructure gaps, added demand delay Jal Jeevan Mission rollout: Water Resources Minister
content: Groundwater insufficiency and four crore additional households cited as reasons for revised 2028 target

title: UPSC shortlists Nitin Agrawal, Ravada A. Chandrasekhar, Yogesh Gupta for SPC post
content: In addition to the three shortlisted candidates, the Kerala government had forwarded the names of DGP Manoj Abraham, and Additional Directors General of Police (ADGP) Suresh Raj Purohit and M.R. Ajith Kumar to the Centre for consideration.

title: 40% kharif sowing completed in Yadgir district
content: We hope that more than 90% of the targeted area will be covered in the rest of the period, says farm official

title: Two students held with LSD stamps
content: The duo was reportedly taken into custody while on their way to Kozhikode railway station after allegedly sourcing the drugs from yet-to-be-identified local peddlers in the city

title: Karnataka extends AEDP in BCom to 85 govt. colleges effective 2025-26
content: The four new programmes are BCom in retail, logistics, e-commerce, banking, finance, service and insurance

title: Cooperation Minister Rajanna hints at ‘major political developments’ after September
content: However, Shivakumar says media is blowing up issues, while Satish Jarkiholi says big changes are unlikely

title: NBA free agency 2025: Latest signings, news, buzz, live reports
content: noggets president Josh Kroenke explains a scenario in which the team could end up trading Nikola Jokic under the second apron . the new york Knicks are still looking for a head coach, and the Boston Celtics are dramatically reshaping their roster .

title: TTD to organise ‘Srinivasa Kalyanotsavams’ in eight cities across U.S.A.
content: The events, scheduled from July 5 to September 1, aim to cater to the spiritual needs of Indians as well as the Telugus residing in the United States

title: Deputy CM Pawan Kalyan performs bhumi puja for Andhra Pradesh State Forest Academy’s permanent campus near Rajamahendravaram
content: Being built on a six-acre reserve forest at Diwancheruvu, the academy will play a greater role in achieving the forest cover targets and conservation, he says

title: Notorious burglar Saleem aka ‘Sunil Shetty’ nabbed again, two house break-ins solved
content: Active since 1991, Mohammed Saleem, also known as Sunil Shetty, has been involved in more than 100 burglary cases across the tri-commissionerates

title: After years of legal battle, Revenue department reclaims 12 acres of government land at Chinnakkanal
content: 12 people, including CPI(M) Santhanpara area committee member V.X. Albin, encroached upon government land and forged titles

title: Former Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik treated by doctor hailing from Coimbatore
content: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister M.K. Stalin wishes Naveen Patnaik a speedy recovery and continued good health

title: Regional Science Museum in Rajamahendravaram will be named after nuclear physicist Gnanananda, says Andhra Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister Pawan Kalyan
content: The museum has been built on a five-acre campus with ₹15.20 crore under the aegis of the National Council of Science Museums

title: ECI trying to implement NRC through backdoor: Mamata
content: Alleging that the ECI was “acting like a stooge of the BJP”, Ms. Banerjee asked whether the move was a backdoor attempt to implement the NRC.

title: Drug menace dangerous than atom bomb, says A.P. Transport Minister
content: Ramprasad Reddy calls on the public to immediately report any drug-related activity to the police on the toll-free number 1972

title: Zohran Mamdani’s New York mayoral win draws flak from Kangana, Congress’s Singhvi
content: When Zohran Mamdani opens his mouth, Pakistan’s PR team takes the day off, says Congress MP Abhishek Manu Singhvi while Kangana Ranaut said, “Whatever happened to his Hindu identity or bloodline and now he is ready to wipe out Hinduism”.

title: ‘Akhanda Godavari’ will become an iconic tourist destination, says Union Tourism Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat
content: The 94-crore project sanctioned under SASCI aims at creating a comprehensive riverfront experience anchored along the 125-year-old Havelock Bridge and Pushkar Ghat

title: Lalu dreams of winning Bihar polls, but can’t even manage his family: Giriraj Singh
content: Lalu Prasad is seeing ‘Mungeri Lal Ke Haseen Sapne’ of winning Bihar polls. The reality is that he can’t even manage his own family, says BJP leader and Union Minister Giriraj Singh

title: Hit-and-run case: Jagan’s quash petition posted for hearing on June 27
content: In his petition filed in the High Court of Andhra Pradesh, the YSRCP president, who is named A2 in the case, has argued that the charges have been tailored to implicate him with political vendetta and malice

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Banning online film reviews will be equivalent to curtailing freedom of speech and expression: Madras High Court
content: Justice N. Anand Venkatesh says, he follows the practice of watching movies that had received negative reviews

title: Tamil actor Krishna also arrested in drug cartel case in Chennai
content: Krishna is the second actor to be arrested in the case; actor Srikanth, alias Sridhar Krishnamachari, was arrested by Chennai police on June 23

title: Won't allow imposition of Hindi in Maharashtra, BJP trying to create language divide: Uddhav
content: The BJP is trying to create a divide among people on the basis of language. It is imposing a language emergency, says former Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray

title: ECI starts proceedings to delist 345 registered unrecognised political parties
content: The offices of these parties could also not be physically located anywhere, the ECI said. These 345 RUPPs are from different states and UTs across the country, it said.

title: Soon, Bengaluru Namma Metro commuters can buy tickets on multiple mobility apps
content: BMRCL will integrate with the ONDC to allow metro tickets to be booked across a variety of plarforms, creating a smooth, all-in-one travel experience for passengers

title: ‘He sounds more Pakistani than Indian’, says Kangana Ranaut on Zohran Mamdani
content: Whatever happened to his Hindu identity or bloodline and now he is ready to wipe out Hinduism, wow!! It’s the same story every where, says Kangana Ranaut in a post on X

title: Andhra Pradesh Minister Nara Lokesh thanks Cognizant CEO for choosing Visakhapatnam as key hub for expansion
content: Nara Lokesh said the upcoming facility is not just an investment in infrastructure (by Cognizant) but a vote of confidence in the youth of Andhra Pradesh

title: SCO summit: Rajnath meets Belarus Defence Minister in Qingdao
content: Mr. Singh's discussions with Mr. Khrenin focused on strengthening Defence cooperation and enhancing regional security, a Defence Ministry spokesperson said in New Delhi.

title: JSW Steel seeks review of Supreme Court verdict ordering liquidation of BPSL
content: Following May 2 ruling rejecting its resolution plan, company moves top court while proceedings remain under status quo

title: Twenty million international tourists expected in current fiscal year in India: Union Tourism Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat
content: “Diversity becomes the core of India’s tourism sector; Tourism in India is no more about monuments and memories and It is about livelihoods and legacy,” says Gajendra Singh Shekhawat

title: Border Security Force seizes 20 gold biscuits near Indo-Bangla border: Official
content: The official said jawans of the 59 Battalion posted at Jeetpur border outpost intercepted a bicycle-borne man when he was trying to cross the border and recovered the gold biscuits

title: Revisiting Emergency through images
content: On the 50th anniversary of imposition of Emergency, we recall the key events through archival images.

title: Gujarat AAP MLA resigns from all party posts; suspended
content: Asked if he was also planning to resign as MLA, Umesh Makwana said he will take a decision after consulting the people of his constituency to make sure they do not suffer

title: Tiger and her four cubs found dead in MM Hills Wildlife Sanctuary in Chamarajanagar district of Karnataka, poisoning suspected
content: Minister for Forests, Ecology and Environment Eshwar B. Khandre has sought a report on the tiger deaths within three days

title: Phone tapping by BRS reflected its criminal mindset: Jagga Reddy
content: The former MLA said that Revanth Reddy is working to become a Chief Minister again in 2029 and he is preparing for 2034

title: ‘If you oppose transfer what will happen to others’: Supreme Court refuses docs plea against transfer
content: "The cosmopolitan life of Bangalore is very alluring. The others areas of Karnataka are also developed. You are a privileged class of society. If you will oppose transfer what will happen to others. We are not inclined to entertain the appeal," the Bench said

title: Woman can’t be deprived of financial support from estranged husband just because she’s earning: Bombay HC
content: The man claimed that his monthly earnings were not high enough to give his wife ₹15,000 each month. As per the man, he also has to take care of his ailing parents. The woman, however, refuted the man’s claims and said he earned over ₹1 lakh per month.

title: 'You have clothes, shoes, mobile phones because of us': BJP MLA sparks row with remarks
content: The former State minister highlighted the BJP-led government's welfare schemes and development work, and went on to berate the critics of his party.

title: Kerala High Court orders ₹2-lakh compensation for evicted traders in NH development project
content: High Court, in its judgment on June 11, 2025, directed that compensation be implemented within 12 weeks. The order will be applicable across Kerala

title: Supreme Court issues guidelines for retention, disposal of records
content: In a message, CJI B.R. Gavai said that over the years, the registry of the Supreme Court has witnessed a significant increase in the volume and diversity of administrative records generated across multiple branches

title: Ahmedabad Air India plane crash: Why us? The emotional aftermath of the air crash
content: Psychiatrists in Ahmedabad help families navigate grief stages after the AI-171 crash, offering support amid chaos and despair

title: Former Andhra Pradesh CM Jagan Mohan Reddy’s quash petition posted by High Court for hearing on June 27
content: The judge observed that perhaps no coercive steps would be taken against petitioner Jagan Mohan Reddy in the meantime

title: Why does the Axiom-4 mission need 28 hours to reach the ISS?
content: To share the ISS’s lane, the Dragon capsule needs to match both its altitude and its velocity vector. This is achieved using raw speed as well as timing

title: Discussions on restoring statehood to J&K should conclude soon, says CM Omar Abdullah
content: Welcoming the sanctioning of several projects for Jammu and Kashmir, including tunnels, costing ₹10,600 crore, the Chief Minister said these projects will give a huge boost to the Union Territory.

title: Filmmaker Lijo Jose Pellissery refutes Joju George’s claim of unpaid remuneration for Churuli
content: In Facebook post, Lijo Jose Pellissery says he decided to come out with an explanation as Joju George’s comments regarding the film have hurt the producers who are his friends
